translation.en: [woman] Let's start at the beginning.
Once upon a time,
in a freezing world…
Huh. This isn't right.
-[record scratching] -Can we start over?
translation.es: Esto no está bien. ¿Empiezo de nuevo?

translation.en: That's better.
You see, our story actually begins here,
in the Land of Frozen Food…
where ice cream never melts…
translation.es: donde el helado no se derrite…

translation.en: and dreams, well, they get frozen, too.
translation.es: pero los sueños también se congelan.

translation.en: This is Waffles. And her little buddy right there?
translation.es: Ella es Waffles, y su pequeño amiguito se llama Mochi.

translation.en: Well, that's Mochi.
translation.es: y su pequeño amiguito se llama Mochi.

translation.en: Two best friends with one big dream, to become chefs.
translation.es: Son mejores amigos con un gran sueño: lograr convertirse en chefs.

translation.en: But let's just say their cooking was a little on the…
translation.es: Pero digamos que todo lo que cocinaban…

translation.en: …cold side.
Ice for breakfast.
Ice for lunch.
Ice for dinner.
But those two, they kept at it.
Know what this could use? -[meeps] -Some shaved ice.
translation.es: ¿Sabes qué le quedaría bien? Un poco de granizado.

translation.en: Bon appétit.
-Bon appétit! -Bon appétit.
[woman] Until one day, -something appeared outside their window. -Ah!
translation.es: Hasta que un día vieron algo por la ventana.

translation.en: Our store's truck had gotten stuck in the snow.
translation.es: El camión de mi tienda se atascó en la nieve.

translation.en: Do you think that truck is going somewhere with real, live, fresh food?
translation.es: ¿Crees que ese camión irá a algún lugar con comida fresca?

translation.en: We've gotta have courage, Mochi, or we'll never learn how to cook.
translation.es: Seamos valientes o jamás aprenderemos a cocinar.

translation.en: You know what? Let's blow this Popsicle stand.
[woman] And just like that, Waffles and Mochi set off
translation.es: Y sin decir más, Waffles y Mochi se embarcaron en la aventura más sabrosa de sus vidas.

translation.en: on the tastiest adventure of their lives.
translation.es: Waffles y Mochi se embarcaron en la aventura más sabrosa de sus vidas.

translation.en: -[Waffles] Mochi, are we there yet? -[Mochi meeps]
-You ready, Mochi? -[Mochi meeps excitedly]
-Let's go. -[kids] ♪ Freeze! ♪
♪ Listen to your vegetables ♪
♪ And eat your parents With Waffles & Mochi ♪
translation.es: y come a tus padres con Waffles y Mochi.

translation.en: [kids] Tomato!
-[Waffles] Are we there yet? -[Mochi murmurs]
How about now?
-How about now? -[Mochi] Mmm.
-[Waffles] We're here. -[horn honks]
[Waffles] Mochi, look at all this fresh food.
translation.es: Mochi, mira toda esta comida fresca.

translation.en: [Waffles] All this food
is made of food.
Excuse me.
A talking shelf.
A talking… uh…
waffle?
Well, my dad is a frozen waffle.
translation.es: Mi papá es un waffle congelado.

translation.en: -My mom is a yeti. -[meeps]
Welcome to the supermarket. I'm Shelfie.
This is my best friend Mochi, I'm Waffles.
translation.es: Él es mi amigo Mochi. Y yo, Waffles.

translation.en: Oh, no. I'm so sorry.
It's all right. We'll get this cleaned up.
Hey, Intercommy.
Clean-up on aisle nine.
Oh. All right. That's me. Here we go.
Oh. Wait. Intercommy, Shelfie…
You must be Moppy.
No!
It's just Steve.
Well, nice to meet ya, Steve.
It's crunchy.
This place is so cool. What do you all do here?
Huh! That's easy. We work here!
Uh! Can we work here, too?
You'll have to ask our store owner. She's the one to ask about working here.
translation.es: Pregúntenle a la dueña, ella toma las decisiones.

translation.en: -Find her upstairs in the garden. -[gasps]
-Upstairs in the garden. -[Mochi murmurs]
Well, hi there.
-Hi. -Who are you two?
-I'm Waffles and this is Mochi. -[murmurs]
translation.es: Soy Waffles y él es Mochi.

translation.en: Well, hello, Waffles and Mochi. -Hi. -I am Mrs. Obama.
translation.es: - Waffles y Mochi, soy la Sra. Obama. - Hola.

translation.en: -What can I do for ya? -We wanna work in the supermarket.
Have you worked in a supermarket before?
-No. -Okay. Have you ever had a job before?
translation.es: - ¿Trabajaron en una tienda antes? - No. ¿Alguna vez trabajaron?

translation.en: -No? -[Busy] Wait a minute. Do you even know what a job is?
-No. -Busy, just hold off a second.
translation.es: No. - Busy, espera un momento. - Bueno.

translation.en: -Okay. -[Mrs. Obama] Excuse him.
translation.es: - Busy, espera un momento. - Bueno. Discúlpenlo.

translation.en: Why don't we give you a chance?
-We'd love that. -Let's start with something simple.
translation.es: - Les daré una oportunidad. - Genial. Empecemos por algo sencillo.

translation.en: -Very. -How about that?
-Yeah, that sounds great. -Let's do it.
-Okay. -Okay.
All right.
You see these?
What a beautiful basket of clown noses.
No, these aren't clown noses. These are tomatoes.
translation.es: No son narices de payaso, son tomates.

translation.en: Wait, whose toes?
-[murmurs] -I picked them fresh from the garden.
All you have to do is go downstairs and put them where they belong.
translation.es: Solo deben ir abajo y ponerlos en su lugar.

translation.en: No way they'll be able to do this.
-Can you do that? -No problemo, Mrs. Obama.
-Excellent. Well, get to it. -Yeah.
-We got this, Mochi. -[coos]
-[grunts] Oh, man. -[Mochi meeps]
Jeez, I wish we had something that could move this, like a… like a skateboard or a roller skate or a…
translation.es: Ojalá tuviéramos algo para moverlos, como una patineta o un patín, o…

translation.en: -[Mochi] Wow! -[gasps] …that!
Yeah.
-[gasps] -[Busy] Oh, dear. Looks like they're gonna take the MagiCart.
translation.es: Vaya, parece que usarán el Magicarro.

translation.en: Um, hi, magical super shopping cart of our dreams.
Hi.
Hello? We need help.
Where does this tomato belong?
Welcome to MagiCart 3000. I see you need help finding out where tomatoes belong.
translation.es: Bienvenidos al Magicarro 3000. ¿Quieren ver dónde van los tomates?

translation.en: Please put on your safety gear and seat belts.
What? We need to do all that? Aren't we just going downstairs?
Well, eventually.
I think we need to gear up.
Three, two, yum!
Blast off!
[Waffles] Listen to your vegetables!
And eat your parents!
-Whoa, buddy. We're flying. -[Mochi laughs]
Where are you taking us?
[MagiCart] Our first stop is Oakland, California,
translation.es: Nuestra primera parada es Oakland, California.

translation.en: where you'll meet Chef Samin Nosrat from the TV show Salt Fat Acid Heat.
translation.es: Allí conocerán a la chef Samin Nosrat, de la serie Salt Fat Acid Heat.

translation.en: Wow, a chef?
-I'm getting hungry. -[meeps]
[kids] Oakland!
Excuse me?
-Hi. -Hi. You surprised me.
-Sorry. -That's okay.
translation.es: Lo siento. Soy Waffles y él es Mochi.

translation.en: -I'm Waffles, and this is Mochi. -Oh, hi. I'm Samin.
translation.es: Lo siento. Soy Waffles y él es Mochi. Hola. Soy Samin.

translation.en: -Hey, Samin. -Are you the new neighbor?
-No. We're figuring out where we belong. -[murmurs]
translation.es: No sabemos cuál es nuestro lugar.

translation.en: Yeah, good point, Mochi.
What we need to figure out is where tomatoes belong.
Have you had a tomato before?
-No. -Would you like to taste one of these?
One of my favorite kinds. Cherry tomatoes.
-Cherry tomatoes? -Yeah. They're little, like cherries.
And they're super sweet.
-Here, there's one for you. -Thank you.
-For you, Mochi. -One for Mochi.
-Okay. -[Mochi munches]
-[Wafles gasps] -[Samin] What does that taste like?
It's juicy, and it burst in my mouth.
translation.es: Es jugoso y me estalló en la boca.

translation.en: And it's fresh.
And it's not frozen.
Is this the first time you had a fresh tomato?
translation.es: - ¿No habían probado un tomate fresco? - No.

translation.en: -Yes. -Is it blowing your mind? It really is. I don't know how to process it.
translation.es: - ¿No es espectacular? - Sí, no sé ni cómo procesarlo.

translation.en: There are actually 10,000 varieties of tomatoes around the world.
translation.es: Hay 10 000 variedades de tomates en todo el mundo.

translation.en: So, people all over the world cook them in all different ways.
translation.es: La gente los cocina de diferentes maneras.

translation.en: -Wow. -You can cook tomatoes?
Yeah. Do you wanna see the other tomatoes I picked?
Oh, yes.
Let's do it. And you know who else is gonna come join us?
translation.es: Vamos. ¿ Y saben quién más vendrá?

translation.en: -Who? -My friend Mia.
[gasps] Hi, Mia. I'm Waffles, and this is Mochi.
translation.es: Hola, Mia. Soy Waffles y él es Mochi.

translation.en: -Come on, Mia. Let's go. -Let's go.
Do you know what a fruit is? Do I know what a fruit is? Of course I do.
translation.es: - ¿Saben qué es una fruta? - ¿Una fruta? Claro.

translation.en: It's a thingamajig that you put on your shelf and admire.
translation.es: Es una cosa para decorar que puedes poner en el estante.

translation.en: -You guys don't know? -No.
-I know. -What is it?
It's something that's…
that you can eat.
Yeah, but can't you eat cheese pizza, too?
-Yeah. -Is that a fruit? -No. -No.
It's something that, when you cut it, the seeds are inside.
translation.es: Cuando cortas una fruta, tiene semillas adentro.

translation.en: You know this? Yes. It's a green baseball.
translation.es: - ¿Saben qué es? - Una pelota de béisbol.

translation.en: -I know what it is. -You--
-It's an apple. -An apple.
I'll cut into it.
-[Waffles] Oh, look, it's got seeds. -[meeps]
Let's try a lemon.
Does it have a seed? There it is.
I'll squirt some in your mouth. [Samin squeaks]
Not all fruits are sweet.
Do you think there's gonna be seeds on the inside of the tomatoes?
Is the tomato a fruit?
[Samin] Do you see all those tiny seeds?
It's got seeds on the inside, Mochi. [Samin] Yeah.
It means that a tomato's a fruit.
Ah! A tomato is a fruit.
Yeah!
Are you guys ready to make some pasta with tomato candy?
-Candy? -Everybody's gonna have a job.
translation.es: - ¿Quieren cocinar pasta con tomate dulce? - ¿Dulce? Todos harán algo.

translation.en: Waffles, you're in charge of the cheese.
-I need you to grate it. -All right.
Keep grating, and don't stop until I tell you you're done.
translation.es: Sigue rallando, te diré cuándo detenerte.

translation.en: Mia, we're gonna put a bunch of tomatoes in this bowl.
translation.es: Mia, pondremos tomates en este bol.

translation.en: -[Mia] Watch out, Mochi. -Grating cheese is like a workout.
translation.es: Cuidado, Mochi. - Es como hacer ejercicio. - Tú puedes, Waffles.

translation.en: -[Mia] Good job, Waffles. -Now, we're gonna put some salt,
translation.es: - Es como hacer ejercicio. - Tú puedes, Waffles. Ahora pondremos sal, azúcar

translation.en: some sugar…
and some olive oil to help make it stick.
translation.es: y aceite de oliva para que se una.

translation.en: That's gonna make the tomatoes extra delicious.
translation.es: Hará que los tomates sepan más deliciosos.

translation.en: Running a cheese marathon.
Now, we're gonna put 'em in our oven.
In the meantime, we can get everything else ready.
Sorry, Mochi. I'm resting my arm.
Mia, will you help pick the basil?
All we have to do now is cook the pasta.
I think you did it all.
-I did it? -Yes, you're done!
Amazing.
The pasta might be ready. Should we check?
Mia, will you help by adding the basil into the bowl?
translation.es: Mia, ¿pones la albahaca en el bol?

translation.en: Now, we can add our last ingredient.
-Tomato. -Tomato candy.
Look at those.
[Samin] Wait till you taste 'em. They taste like candy.
translation.es: Ya verán cuando los prueben, son deliciosos.

translation.en: We should put the whole tray in.
-Should I just dump it in? -Dump it all!
-[Waffles laughs] -Know what the finishing touch is?
-[Mia] Cheese! -[Samin] Time to have a bite.
-Don't tomatoes taste like candy? -[Waffles] That is amazing.
translation.es: - ¿Los tomates no saben muy dulces? - Deliciosos.

translation.en: I can't believe we just met, and now we're eating together.
translation.es: Recién nos conocemos y estamos comiendo juntos.

translation.en: That's what cooking and eating together can do.
translation.es: Eso es lo bueno de cocinar juntos.

translation.en: And now we know where tomatoes belong.
translation.es: Ahora sabemos dónde van los tomates.

translation.en: ♪ I'm not a vegetable ♪
♪ I'm just misunderstood ♪
♪ I've never been a vegetable ♪
♪ And I wouldn't be if I could ♪
♪ Put me in a certain aisle ♪
♪ Like there's no more to discover ♪
♪ But you gotta read my whole book ♪
translation.es: Pero no juzgues a un libro

translation.en: ♪ Not just look at the cover ♪
♪ People take one look at me And they think they know who I am ♪
translation.es: Ellos piensan conocer y me juzgan por lo que ven.

translation.en: ♪ But I'm here to say Once and for all ♪
♪ So that everyone can understand ♪
translation.es: y entiendan de una buena vez.

translation.en: ♪ I'm a fruit ♪
[vocalizing] ♪ I'm a fruit ♪
♪ Don't define me so fast ♪
♪ 'Cause I'm here to say, at last ♪
♪ That, baby ♪ ♪ I'm a fruit ♪
♪ Don't box me in ♪
♪ Unless you're putting me in ♪
♪ A pizza box ♪
♪ It tastes so good ♪
♪ And no matter What kind of tomato you are ♪
translation.es: Hay tomates distintos y no debe importar.

translation.en: ♪ Sliced or diced or in a jar ♪
♪ In ketchup or on a salad bar ♪
translation.es: Si en salsa o en ensalada vas,

translation.en: ♪ Or sun-dried in a primavera ♪
♪ Tomato ♪
♪ I said, "A tomato" ♪
♪ Is a fruit ♪
[vocalizing] ♪ I'm a fruit ♪
♪ Don't define me so fast ♪
♪ 'Cause I'm here to say, at last ♪
♪ That, baby, I'm a fruit ♪
♪ That's right ♪
[Waffles] Mochi, I can't believe we just ate food that was not frozen.
translation.es: Mochi, comimos algo que no estaba congelado.

translation.en: Look at those tomatoes, Mochi. Should we go inside?
-[meeps excitedly] -Yeah, for research, obviously.
-Hello. -Oh, hey.
-I'm Katie. -Oh, hi, Katie.
So, we saw a tomato outside.
Is this a tomato restaurant? Can we order tomatoes?
You can order a pizza.
-Oh, pizza! We love frozen pizza. -[meeps]
You have come to the best place to eat pizza.
translation.es: Han venido al mejor lugar para comer pizza.

translation.en: -What? -This is Mozzeria.
-[Waffles] They make pizza here? -They make the best pizza.
translation.es: ¿Y hacen pizza? Hacen la mejor pizza.

translation.en: -Hey, what are you doing with your hands? -I'm talking with my hands,
translation.es: ¿Qué haces con las manos? Hablo con las manos

translation.en: because everyone who works here is Deaf, and they communicate by using their hands.
translation.es: porque todos los empleados son sordos y se comunican con las manos.

translation.en: What does it mean when you're Deaf?
What it means when you're Deaf-- It means you can't hear.
You don't use your ears to hear.
translation.es: No usas los oídos para oír.

translation.en: You use your eyes to hear.
So, everyone here uses their hands to talk?
That's right. What's your favorite pizza?
[Katie translates] The Margherita is the most delicious because of the sauce,
translation.es: La pizza margarita es la más deliciosa por la salsa,

translation.en: and the sauce is pretty much just tomato.
translation.es: y la salsa está hecha con mucho tomate.

translation.en: I had no idea so much tomato went into pizza.
translation.es: No sabía que la pizza tenía tomate.

translation.en: -[murmurs] -[Waffles] Amazing.
Do you know what I think is the coolest part about this restaurant?
translation.es: ¿Saben qué es lo mejor de este lugar?

translation.en: [Waffles] No.
The staff uses their hands to communicate,
translation.es: Los empleados usan las manos para hablar,

translation.en: but they're also using their hands to make the delicious pizza.
translation.es: pero también las usan para preparar la deliciosa pizza.

translation.en: Also, the communication and the food are the same.
translation.es: Entonces, la comunicación y la comida son iguales.

translation.en: It's so cool.
-This is Amanda. This is her place. -Hi.
Amanda, how do you sign "pizza"?
-Pizza. -Pizza.
-That was perfect. -Thanks.
-[Katie] Margherita. Here it is. -Pizza.
Here you go, Waffles.
It's all melted together and warm. Mochi, get in on this.
translation.es: Está todo muy sabroso. Pruébalo, Mochi.

translation.en: -[Waffles] What did you think, bud? -[Mochi trilling]
Wow, so awesome that tomatoes are fruits. -Huh, Mochi? -Oh.
translation.es: Es genial que los tomates sean frutas, ¿no?

translation.en: As soon as we put tomatoes in the fruit section, we get to stay at the grocery store forever.
translation.es: Los pondremos con la fruta y podremos trabajar en la tienda.

translation.en: Well, technically, a tomato is a fruit, but chefs use it like it's a vegetable.
translation.es: Técnicamente, un tomate es una fruta, pero los chefs lo usan como verduras.

translation.en: What? Wait, wait, wait. You're saying that a tomato is a vegetable?
I'm so confused.
Does it belong with the fruits? With vegetables?
translation.es: ¿Va con las frutas o las verduras?

translation.en: [Waffles] Come on. We gotta get out of here. Vegetable fruit.
Oh. Excuse me. Can I take a bite for the road? Oh, yeah.
[translating from Italian] A tomato is a fruit.
[from Spanish] A vegetable.
[from Japanese] Fruit, because tomatoes are sweet.
translation.es: Es una fruta, porque es dulce.

translation.en: [from Italian] Vegetable. It's not sweet enough.
translation.es: Verdura, porque no es tan dulce.

translation.en: [Spanish] Vegetable.
-[Italian] Vegetable. -[Japanese] Vegetables.
They don't look like fruit.
[Spanish] Vegetable.
[Japanese] I think tomatoes are vegetables.
[Italian] A tomato is a vegetable.
A tomato is a fruit.
Why? Because it has seeds inside.
MagiCart, help. We thought tomato was a fruit,
translation.es: ¡Ayuda! Creíamos que eran frutas, pero oímos que son verduras.

translation.en: but then we heard it's a vegetable.
translation.es: Creíamos que eran frutas, pero oímos que son verduras.

translation.en: Well, what's a vegetable?
Well, a fruit is the part of a plant with seeds.
translation.es: La fruta es la parte con semillas de una planta.

translation.en: Everything else, like the plant's roots, stems, and leaves, are vegetables.
translation.es: La raíz, el tallo y las hojas son verduras.

translation.en: You're gonna tell us where tomatoes go in the store, right?
translation.es: ¿Nos dirás dónde van los tomates en la tienda?

translation.en: No, but I know just the person to ask.
translation.es: No, pero sé a quién preguntarle.

translation.en: Let's swing by Washington, D.C., and ask Chef José Andrés.
translation.es: Vayamos a Washington a ver al chef José Andrés.

translation.en: He wrote the book on vegetables. Literally.
Sounds like the perfect person to ask.
Would you expect anything less from me?
Well, we don't even know you yet, MagiCart. Cool it.
[kids] Washington, D.C.
Where are we? Oh, hey. Excuse me.
-Hey. -Are you Chef José Andrés?
translation.es: - Hola, disculpa. - Hola. - ¿Eres el chef José Andrés? - Sí.

translation.en: Yes.
Maybe you can help us. We're confused. We need to put tomatoes away at the store.
translation.es: ¿Nos ayudarías? Nos confunde mucho dónde poner los tomates.

translation.en: We learned it was a fruit, then someone told us it was a vegetable.
translation.es: Oímos que eran frutas, y luego que eran verduras.

translation.en: So where does it belong, you know?
translation.es: No sabemos cuál es su lugar.

translation.en: Well, technically, technically, it's a fruit.
But then, in normal talk, we say it's a vegetable.
translation.es: Pero normalmente decimos que son verduras,

translation.en: Why? Because we use it in salads. We use it in savory dishes.
translation.es: porque los usamos en ensaladas y platos salados.

translation.en: So, you're saying that a tomato can be a fruit and a vegetable?
translation.es: ¿Dices que un tomate puede ser una fruta y una verdura?

translation.en: Yes. And you will be right in both ways.
We're gonna make a recipe that I learned from my wife.
translation.es: Prepararemos algo que aprendí de mi esposa.

translation.en: -Really? -It's called gazpacho.
Gazpacho is from the south of Spain.
It's always hot weather because it's always a beautiful sun in the sky.
translation.es: Hace mucho calor porque siempre sale el bello sol.

translation.en: Oh, so who wants hot soup in a hot-weather place? -It's a cold soup. -[gasping]
translation.es: - No quiero sopa caliente si hace calor. - Es una sopa fría.

translation.en: So, we need tomatoes.
Tomatoes go into this blender.
-Cucumber. -Cucumber.
Here. And now, green pepper.
-Garlic. -Garlic.
Garlic in.
This goes in here.
And then, one of my favorite ingredients.
translation.es: Y uno de mis ingredientes favoritos.

translation.en: -What do you think is it? -Is that olive oil?
From olives from the olive tree.
And one more ingredient.
Vinegar.
You wanna honor the tradition of Spain, you put sherry vinegar.
translation.es: La tradición en España es usar vinagre de jerez.

translation.en: We put salt.
And one important ingredient.
Love?
Bread.
Oh, bread.
-Wow! That's crunchy. -[bread crunching]
Now, we're gonna blend it.
-Let's blend this. -One, two, three.
Oh, yeah! Oh, yeah!
It's a big party!
It's a gazpacho party!
Oh, yeah!
All right. So, the tomato is ready.
This is what you do. You chop the tomatoes into cubes,
translation.es: El tomate debe estar cortado en cubitos.

translation.en: and you put the cubes in the plate.
translation.es: Pondremos los cubitos en el plato.

translation.en: And then, the cucumber.
-The green pepper. -[Mochi] Mmm!
Croutons, cubes of bread.
A bit of the olive oil,
translation.es: Un poco de aceite de oliva,

translation.en: and now we need to finish with your favorite new friend.
translation.es: y ahora terminamos con su nuevo amigo favorito.

translation.en: A big cut on the top,
and then you make a cut right there.
And there, the tomato seeds.
The most flavorful part.
translation.es: Son la parte que más sabor tiene.

translation.en: And now, you let the party begin.
translation.es: Y ahora, que empiece la fiesta.

translation.en: The tomatoes, the green peppers,
-cucumbers, playing with each other. -[Mochi] Uh-huh!
translation.es: y los pepinos juegan entre ellos.

translation.en: -Do you hear? Can you hear the sound? -[voice vocalizes softly]
[Waffles] I'm listening.
-[faint crackling] -All these sound is that they are happy.
translation.es: Este sonido significa que están muy felices.

translation.en: Time to eat.
-[fireworks whistling] -It's really fresh.
Well, we came from the Land of Frozen Foods,
translation.es: Vinimos aquí desde Comicongelandia, donde todo está congelado,

translation.en: where everything was frozen and came here. We didn't know where we belonged.
translation.es: Vinimos aquí desde Comicongelandia, donde todo está congelado, a buscar nuestro lugar.

translation.en: So, I think this gazpacho
is telling a lot of who I am,
and I think it's gonna give you clues
translation.es: y los ayudará a descubrir cuál es su lugar,

translation.en: to finding who you are, where you're going, because,
translation.es: y los ayudará a descubrir cuál es su lugar, porque este gazpacho es de España,

translation.en: this gazpacho is from Spain, but then,
translation.es: porque este gazpacho es de España, pero muchos ingredientes son de otros lugares.

translation.en: many ingredients came from other parts of the world.
translation.es: pero muchos ingredientes son de otros lugares.

translation.en: -And guess what? -What?
I learned that gazpacho can be…
from anywhere. It belongs everywhere.
It belongs to a place that people gives love to the gazpacho.
translation.es: Su lugar es donde lo preparen con amor.

translation.en: [Waffles] Yeah.
Hopefully, we can figure out where we belong.
translation.es: Quizá descubramos cuál es el nuestro.

translation.en: If we listen to our food, maybe it'll tell us who we are.
translation.es: Si escuchamos a la comida, nos dirá quiénes somos.

translation.en: -[twinkles] -Hey.
You two ready to put those tomatoes where they belong?
translation.es: ¿Listos para poner los tomates en su lugar?

translation.en: Yeah. Mochi, we've got a job to do.
translation.es: Sí. Mochi, tenemos trabajo que hacer.

translation.en: [MagiCart] Now arriving at the supermarket.
Good luck.
All right, Mochi. Wait, you're not Mochi.
Mochi, we can put these tomatoes away. We know where they belong.
translation.es: Mochi, ordenemos los tomates. Sabemos dónde van.

translation.en: They're a fruit.
Wait, you think they're a vegetable?
But Samin said they're a fruit.
translation.es: Pero Samin dijo que eran frutas.

translation.en: I mean, sure.
Chef José said people use them like vegetables, but…
translation.es: El chef José dijo que se usan como verduras,

translation.en: Ugh. I don't know.
Fruit? [pants]
Vegetable?
Fruit?
[echoing] Vegetable?
-Beautiful, huh? -Look at this great spread.
-Thanks for bringing this up. -You're welcome.
-My pleasure. -Delicious.
[Busy] Wanted to spend time with my mentor. See the rosemary spread?
translation.es: Quería pasar tiempo con mi mentora. ¿Ves eso?

translation.en: Wow, and the bakery is really--
Well, well, well.
-Hey, you two. -Well, if it isn't Falafel and Mocha.
translation.es: - Hola, chicos. - Son Falafel y Moca.

translation.en: -Waffles and Mochi. -Busy.
Oh, pardon me.
I heard somebody is trying to figure out where tomatoes go.
translation.es: Oí que alguien quería saber dónde van los tomates.

translation.en: -Mh-hm. -Guess who figured it out?
-Who? -We did.
They belong everywhere.
translation.es: Los tomates van en todas partes.

translation.en: Well, I guess that is a choice.
Not a good choice, if you ask me.
We put them everywhere because they can go anywhere.
Tomatoes are a fruit because their seeds are inside.
translation.es: Los tomates son frutas porque tienen semillas,

translation.en: But tomatoes are also a vegetable because that's how chefs and most people use them.
translation.es: pero también son verduras, porque así se usan en la cocina.

translation.en: Like in pizza or gazpacho.
translation.es: Como en la pizza o el gazpacho.

translation.en: It's really interesting.
You two showed me a new way to think about tomatoes.
And you see, whenever an employee demonstrates a high level of mastery
translation.es: Cuando un empleado demuestra un gran saber

translation.en: of our edible inventory, they're awarded a prestigious honor.
translation.es: de nuestro inventario comestible, recibe un honor.

translation.en: Aren't they, Mrs. Obama?
What Busy is trying to say is that when employees around here
translation.es: Lo que él quiere decir es que cuando un empleado

translation.en: do something good and show an expertise in something, they get a badge.
translation.es: hace algo bien o demuestra saber mucho, gana una insignia.

translation.en: So, it is my distinct honor
translation.es: Así que será un gran honor para mí

translation.en: to present you with something.
-Wow! -Before I do that,
I want to tell you both how proud I am of you.
Like the tenacious tomato,
you didn't give up on finding where you belong.
translation.es: no renunciaron a hallar su lugar.

translation.en: And I can only imagine how you two must have felt, falling into this new world.
translation.es: Debe haber sido muy confuso hallarse de repente en este nuevo mundo.

translation.en: You worked hard today,
and you discovered that you belong, like the tomato, everywhere.
translation.es: descubrieron que, como el tomate, su lugar es en todas partes.

translation.en: You belong here with us.
This, Mochi and Waffles, is your new home.
translation.es: Mochi y Waffles, este es su nuevo hogar.

translation.en: And so, I want to reward you proudly
translation.es: Por esa razón, con orgullo les entregaré como premio

translation.en: with the Tomato Badge.
[Waffles] Yeah!
-[Mrs. Obama] In honor of your tenacity -[meeps] and your courage,
translation.es: Gracias a la tenacidad y el valor que demostraron,

translation.en: you now belong here with us. You're a part of our family.
translation.es: su lugar está aquí, como parte de nuestra familia.

translation.en: So, where do we put these?
On your official apron, of course.
[robotic voice] Tomato!
Yes! We have a job. We work here now.
-Busy. Join us. -I'll get in on it, too.
